meanings.definition: A person or thing that bends something.
meanings.sent1: The metal bender shaped the wire into a spiral.
meanings.sent2: The tree branch was a natural bender, curving gracefully towards the ground.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy thought the hose was a fun bender to twist and turn.
meanings.sent4: Her flexible mind was a bender of ideas, always finding new ways to solve problems.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor was a master bender, effortlessly contorting her body into complex poses.

meanings.sent1: After exams, the students went on a bender to celebrate their hard work.
meanings.sent2: He regretted going on a bender last night when he woke up with a headache.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a stash of fermented berries and went on a bender in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The town's annual festival turned into a bender of music, dancing, and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The sailors returned from their long voyage and went on a bender to enjoy the comforts of land.
